alternatives.transcript: welcome to this training session about the master settlement agreement this training is designed to give you a general understanding of the settlement which Philip Morris and other tobacco product manufacturers entered into with 46 States and five

territories this session will not give enough detail to answer all the questions that may arise in the course of your business rather our purpose is to give you a broad understanding of the settlement particularly of the issues that will affect you most closely so that you will know when to ask questions to make sure the company stays in compliance with this settlement here is our agenda we will start with a message from the president and CEO of Philip

Morris USA then we will place the settlement in context next we will take you through significant portions of the settlement we will also discuss briefly the four states that entered into separate settlement agreements the senior vice president of corporate Affairs will wrap up the training if by the end of the training you have any questions about the settlement please be sure to ask for clarification now you will hear from the president and CEO
Philip Morris USA

hi and welcome to this training session on the master settlement agreement in November 1998 Philip Morris USA along with the other tobacco companies reached an unprecedented agreement with 46 States and other government authorities to deal with issues of common concern regarding the advertising and marketing of cigarettes and certain other subjects the agreement called the master settlement agreement or the MSA also set

litigation brought against the companies by the states for reimbursement of Medicaid costs the MSA lays out many guidelines for the way tobacco products may be marketed advertised and promoted these parameters are in response to societal concerns regarding cigarette advertising and marketing particularly as those concerns relate to kids we believe that the MSA will bring a new measure of stability to our industry on some of the issues

as in controversies regarding tobacco products we strongly believe that entering into the MSA was the right thing to do it will help us achieve the business and individual goals we share as Philip Morris employees the MSA has required us to do some things differently but I want to emphasize that compliance with the MSA is completely consistent with our mission our values and our core strategies our

is to be the most responsible effective and respected developer manufacturer and marketer of consumer products the MSA provides a framework that helps Define some of our responsibilities as employees of p.m. USA we want to operate with Integrity trust and respect which means we meet or exceed the policies requirements regulations and agreements that apply to our business we must bring the same passion to

exceed and quality of execution to complying with the MSA that we bring to the other aspects of our business consistent with our continuing commitment to help reduce the incidence of you smoking we encourage any employee who has ideas on how we can help reduce youth access to tobacco products and the incidence of you smoking to share these ideas with are you smoking prevention department any employee can submit an idea

by obtaining a special form via email from the you smoking prevention department hard copies of the form are available at the facilities News Center in Richmond and at the facility entrance in Cabarrus

this training session is your opportunity to get important information about the MSA please listen carefully to the information presented learn and don't hesitate to ask questions once you've gone through the training session I have every expectation that you will conduct yourself in a way that shows the company's commitment to the master settlement agreement

thanks for your attention and now I'll turn the session back to your hosts let's talk about how the settlement fits into the legal framework for the Philip Morris USA business there are many ways in which the business of Philip Morris USA is regulated and they all need to be taken into account in what we do the state agreements that affect Philip Morris USA include both the settlement and certain individual agreements these

agreements impact a number of Philip Morris activities in addition to these State agreements there is federal legislation most notably the federal cigarette labeling act and various regulations and agreements with the Federal Trade Commission that also governed the business of Philip Morris USA state and local laws including local marketing and advertising ordinances govern the Philip Morris USA business in individual states

cities and towns the cigarette advertising and promotion code a voluntary code of conduct that Philip Morris USA and other manufacturers adopted many years ago provides another guidepost for the business finally the corporate policies of Philip Morris USA and individual programs such as action against access provide additional guidelines for the operation of the business

the focus of our training today is the master settlement agreement this settlement was signed November 23rd 1998 it settles claims by States and state subdivisions that had sought reimbursement of health care costs they allegedly expended as a result of smoking the November 1998 settlement covers 46 States shown here in magenta excluding the states of Texas Mississippi Florida and Minnesota Each of which had

usually negotiated a separate settlement it includes the District of Columbia the settlement also covers five territories on this side of the world Puerto Rico and the US Virgin Islands on the other side of the world the northern Marianas Guam and American Samoa let's talk about how the settlement affects you first Philip Morris takes compliance extremely seriously and needs every one of you thinking about compliance

the and helping the company stay in compliance as we move through the session today you'll see that the settlement effects Marketing sales lobbying public speaking membership in trade associations and other areas ask yourself as you listen today and when you are working if there are checkpoints or systems or procedures that you think might help your business area stay in compliance the company welcomes your thoughts and feedback the settlement is a

X agreement spanning 147 Pages including 54 definitions it includes another 110 pages of exhibits that provide further detail you will be receiving a hand out of the settlement Provisions that are most apt to affect your activities there are other topics and details that you will see in the handout that we are not addressing today in view of the detail and complexity of the settlement we expect questions we encourage

encourage your questions when in doubt ask let's spend a moment looking at an overview of the settlement the settlement is an agreement that binds the entities that signed it note the word agreement it is not a law and it does not bind entities that did not sign in the settlement the participating manufacturers those are the tobacco manufacturers that signed the settlement have agreed to make payments limit marketing commit to assist

the reduction of Youth smoking limit lobbying and restrict some other matters which we will discuss throughout the training in exchange the 46 States and five territories that settled have agreed to give releases of their claims against the participating manufacturers relating to the sale manufacture marketing development research and health effects of tobacco use in addition they release any claims they might have had against off

officers and employees of the participating manufacturers agencies such as advertising agencies or Public Relation firms working for the participating manufacturers and Distributors to the extent the Distributors sell product manufactured by a company that signed the settlement the states have not released any claim they might have against a retailer or wholesaler to the extent it is selling product of a tobacco manufacturer that did not sign the settlement
let's turn first to the provisions that relate to marketing marketing restrictions apply in a number of areas and affect many Beyond those in the marketing organization

the first marketing restriction is a broad prohibition of any action direct or indirect to Target youth in the advertising promotion or marketing of tobacco products this provision also prohibits any action to initiate maintain or increase youth smoking youth is defined by the settlement as under 18

Philip Morris does not mark it to youth further the company has long supported programs designed to reduce both youth access and youth smoking consistent with the settlement Philip Morris has reaffirmed its commitment to help reduce both youth access and youth smoking under the settlement Philip Morris agreed to cease Outdoor Advertising Outdoor advertising is defined in the settlement to include billboards

signs that Arenas stadia malls and video arcades it also includes other signs that are outside or are on an inside window facing out in other words anything that is outside and some things that are inside fall within the definition of outdoor under the settlement the settlement does provide some exceptions to this definition among them the definition of outdoor advertising does not include

advertisements outside a tobacco product manufacturing facility advertisements outside on the property of a retail establishment if each advertisement is 14 square feet or less advertisements inside a retail establishment as long as any advertisement on an inside window facing out is 14 square feet or less this exception does not apply to malls or video arcades an establishment that sells tobacco
products only in vending machines is not considered retail for these exceptions

what is 14 square feet the exception to the definition of outdoor for items that are 14 square feet or less located on the property of a retail establishment refers to a single advertisement of that size however any advertisement that is made up of a mosaic or series of separate ads which when put together create a new bigger ad would have to Total less than 14 square feet if measured all
Heather

Philip Morris and other participating manufacturers also agreed to eliminate Transit advertisements a Transit advertisement is defined by the settlement as an advertisement on or within a transportation waiting area this includes bus and train stations airports and taxi stands it is also defined to include on or within a public or private vehicle this would include advertising on or within taxicabs

cars buses Subway's company trucks and Company Vans there are some exceptions to the definition of Transit advertisements for example advertisements that are outside the premises of a retail establishment or on an inside window facing out if each advertisement is 14 square feet or less this could refer for example to a retailer at an airport again vending sales only do not qualify as

as retail what was the timing for the restrictions on outdoor and Transit advertising these restrictions are in effect now under the settlement no new outdoor or Transit advertisements could be placed after November 23 1998 all Billboards signs it Arenas and Transit ads were required to be removed by April 22nd 1999

Philip Morris engaged in a substantial effort to get all Philip Morris copy off Billboards out of Arena and Transit locations by the deadline after the billboard copy was removed the field sales force helped perform a nationwide audit of the billboard locations to confirm that Philip Morris is effort was successful

to recap the outdoor and Transit restrictions advertising must be 14 square feet or less to be placed outside on the property of a retail establishment or on an inside window facing out advertisements that are over 14 square feet may not be placed outside or on inside windows facing out even at retail Philip Morris believes it complied with all removal requirements under the settlement it
your responsibility to help the company stay in compliance

the settlement prohibits any participating manufacturer from paying for anyone to use display or make reference in media to any tobacco product package or advertising that shows a cigarette brand name media is defined differently in the settlement than in traditional usage in the settlement media means movies television theater or other live performances live or recorded performances of Music film video
or video games

the settlement makes frequent reference to adult only facilities and the diligence required for a facility to be considered adult only so let's focus on that for a moment there are certain activities that are permitted only in an adult only facility an adult only facility under the settlement is a facility or restricted area where the operator ensures or has a reasonable basis to believe that no underage person is present

in Most states and the five territories that means that no one under 18 is present in Alabama Alaska and Utah the operator must take steps to ensure that no one under 19 is present appropriate steps for the operator to take would include checking identification as required under state law or checking the identification of any person appearing to be under the age of 27

to qualify as an adult only facility a facility need not be permanently restricted it need only be restricted during the time when the operator wants to qualify it as an adult only facility the settlement also prohibits participating manufacturers from Distributing free samples except in an adult only facility as you may know Philip Morris does not distribute free samples as part of its marketing activities as a matter of policy

another restriction under the settlement is a minimum pack size of 20 cigarettes this restriction expires December 31st 2001 unless individual states passed minimum pack size legislation by that time such legislation would result in any non-settling tobacco companies being treated the same as those that settle Philip Morris has agreed not to oppose future minimum pack size legislation

a few Philip Morris packing sold in Puerto Rico contained fewer than 20 cigarettes per pack and were affected by this restriction these packings Ellen M tends and Marlborough and Merit 14 S no longer are in distribution because of the settlement the settlement also prohibits the use of cartoons cartoon is a defined term under the settlement it means a depiction with comically exaggerated features although humor

still okay it also means a depiction that attributes human characteristics to animals plants or objects accordingly you will no longer see advertising such as the old Benson & Hedges moments of pleasure lounging cigarette ads finally cartoon means a depiction that attributes unnatural abilities or extra human abilities the settlement give specific examples x-ray vision tunneling at very high speeds impervious

- to pain and transformation the settlement prohibits distribution of apparel or merchandise bearing a brand name let's look at what a brand name is under the settlement the definition of brand name has many facets brand name means the name of a brand like Marlboro or Parliament a trademark like the Red Roof for Marlboro a logo a symbol a recognizable pattern of colors a motto

selling message like come to where the flavor is or any other indicia of a product identification identifiable with any domestic tobacco product brand name does not include the name Philip Morris as long as it is not a domestic tobacco brand name

now let's turn to the reference of apparel or merchandise apparel clearly is clothing what is merchandise Philip Morris is not Distributing consumer goods such as backpacks tents and lighters that bear a brand name

with respect to items placed at retail at the point of sale Philip Morris is not Distributing to retailers branded newspaper racks or clocks shopping baskets or door chimes thermometers ashtrays and change maths to recap there is to be no distribution of apparel or merchandise bearing a brand name Philip Morris has made a determined effort to identify and dispose of its inventories of apparel or merchandise that bore a brand name

in addition there are processes in place to prevent distribution of branded apparel and Merchandising there are a few exceptions to this provision including a narrow exception permitting the distribution of branded items to employees for their personal use if you find yourself questioning whether a particular item may still be distributed ask the appropriate contact with in Philip Morris either your supervisor or the legal department if the

may not be distributed ask for instructions on how to dispose of the item the settlement also prohibits gifts based on proof of purchase without sufficient proof that the person receiving the gift is an adult gifts include any item obtained in exchange for the purchase of tobacco products or the Furnishing of credits proofs of purchase or coupons

this includes items distributed by Marlborough and the other brand groups in so called continuity programs to Smoker's 21 and over who've saved upc's or emblems from the packs they've purchased what is sufficient proof of age well the settlement makes clear that a government issued ID or illegible photocopy of a government-issued ID is sufficient if the validity of the ID is certified by the person to whom the item is to be provided in the

case of items being distributed at retail a participating manufacturer May rely on the retailer to verify age as long as age verification is required under the law Philip Morris has a team who have identified and implemented an appropriate process for age verification under the settlement Philip Morris requires that government issued ID reflect name signature address and date of birth

brand-name sponsorships are limited under the settlement a brand name sponsorship is defined in the settlement as an event where payment is made in exchange for use of a brand name certain sponsorships are prohibited there may be no concerts no events in which the intended audience includes a significant percentage of Youth no event with paid participants or contestants under age 18 and no athletic events between opposing teams in football

basketball baseball soccer or hockey leagues note that there can also be no payments made to teams in those sports leagues for use of a brand name so as long as the company is not running a prohibited sponsorship are there any more limits yes there is a limit to one brand name sponsorship in a 12-month period that is one sponsorship per company not for brand other restrictions apply with respect

respect to sponsorships which the brand groups are aware of an exception from the definition of sponsorship that is important to know sponsorships in the name of Philip Morris as opposed to in the name of a brand are permitted for its one sponsorship Philip Morris is sponsored Marlboro Team Penske in the cart FedEx Championship Series in view of the Restriction that limits Philip Morris to one brand name sponsorship Philip Morris

an official choice of its one sponsorship accordingly no other sponsorships can be undertaken using a brand name in customer tournaments Barbecues in the like if Philip Morris pays to participate the reference should be to Philip Morris not to a brand name

let's cover a few additional marketing restrictions it is not permissible to cause a stadium or Arena to be named with a tobacco brand name it is not permissible to make payment for the right to use a brand name associated with a product other than tobacco therefore for example Philip Morris could not pay to use the name of your favorite race car driver as a tobacco brand name another restriction is that Philip Morris cannot enter into

to an agreement that prohibits a third party from selling purchasing or displaying advertising that discourages the use of tobacco products or exposure to secondhand smoke an example might include a contract that restricted the other parties right to display advertising that supports an anti-smoking theme Philip Morris could not use or enforce a provision of that nature

another important restriction Philip Morris USA is not permitted to license or authorize a third party to use or advertise a brand name in ways that Philip Morris USA could not of course most Philip Morris employees would not be permitted to license third parties to use the Philip Morris trademarks on their own in any event there is another aspect to this provision as well if a state attorney general notifies Philip Morris

that a third party is using a Philip Morris brand name in a way that Philip Morris could not use it Philip Morris must take commercially reasonable steps to stop that third party from using the brand name in that manner in another situation Philip Morris acted to prevent a third party manufacturer from using the Marlboro trademark on a Model Marlboro race car Philip Morris employees noticed the cars for sale concerned about potential youth
issues the employees reported the situation and Philip Morris issued a cease-and-desist letter to the manufacturer

as we mentioned at the outset there are a number of other restrictions in the settlement the settlement prohibits a participating manufacturers opposition to certain legislative proposals or administrative rules that are intended to reduce youth access and youth smoking the rules and legislative proposals which Philip Morris may not oppose are listed in exhibit F which appears on the last page of the MSA excerpts which you were provided

among other things Philip Morris may not oppose directly or through a third party or affiliate limits on youth access to vending machines enforcement of Youth access restrictions both at retail and by penalizing youth for possession use of Technology such as ID scanners to increase effectiveness of minimum age laws and a number of other items the settlement makes clear that opposition to excise
is or income taxes or user fees is not precluded in other words Philip Morris May Lobby against any form of excise tax income tax or user fees on tobacco products

further Philip Morris has agreed not to support the diversion of settlement funds away from tobacco-related or health-related uses Philip Morris has agreed not to support any legislation that would limit state rights or recoveries under the settlement as mentioned earlier Philip Morris has agreed not to oppose legislation that specifies a minimum pack size of 20 cigarettes

to whom do the lobbying restrictions apply people acting for Philip Morris USA including employees contract lobbyists and third parties in addition everyone who engages in lobbying activities must certify that they will act only on Express authorization be aware of and comply with this settlement laws applicable to their lobbying activities and Philip Morris USA is Corporate principles the certification requirement is

did to anyone who engages in lobbying activities who is that the definitions of lobbying and lobbyists vary by state in some states it means asking others to express their opinions about pending legislation to legislative officials in some states it is based on whether you get paid for expressing your View to a legislative official in other words the definitions vary the participating manufacturer is

wired to get the appropriate certifications Philip Morris is obtaining proper certifications where necessary generally lobbying activities do not include expressing your personal view to your own elected official if you are not acting on behalf of the company if you engage in activities on behalf of Philip Morris that you believe might qualify as lobbying activities or if you are uncertain you should raise questions to determine whether or not you

need to certify please contact your manager or state government Affairs regional director for further assistance let's talk about a few other restrictions there are limits on participation in tobacco-related trade associations participating manufacturers agreed to dissolve three associations in addition if a tobacco-related trade Association is new or is controlled by a participating manufacturer the settlement specifies certain

certain requirements on the creation of bylaws appointment of officers selection of counsel the creation of minutes and other items there is a Prohibition against making any material misrepresentation of fact about the health consequences of using tobacco products or tobacco additives filters paper or other ingredients all those circumstances May differ particularly between New York and Richmond employees a rule of thumb is

not to speak on behalf of Philip Morris unless you are an authorized spokesperson s if you are an authorized spokesperson you should be using an approved current statement because it will have Incorporated the company's best most up-to-date scientific understanding there can be no agreements among manufacturers to limit or suppress research on smoking and health or on product development

the settlement requires that product intended for export display a visible indicator on the pack that it is intended for export packs that Philip Morris USA makes for sale by Affiliates of Philip Morris International outside the United States have the legend us tax exempt for use outside us the company has made some additional commitments Philip Morris has committed to restate or reaffirm its commitment to comply with the set

and and to a reduction in underage tobacco use you heard the president and CEO of Philip Morris USA Today in his message expressing those commitments the participating manufacturers also agreed to each appoint an executive to identify ways to reduce youth smoking Philip Morris took that action before the settlement when it established the youth smoking prevention group and appointed a senior vice president to head up that group's efforts

the participating manufacturers each agreed to encourage employees to identify methods to reduce youth smoking the youth smoking prevention department reviews employee suggestions of methods to reduce youth smoking in addition the participating manufacturers agreed to put onto the internet additional documents including business documents that come up in litigation that wraps up the overview of the settlement let's turn for a moment to the

we're states that settled before the settlement the four states that had settled with Philip Morris and other tobacco manufacturers before the master settlement agreement are Florida Minnesota Mississippi and Texas the four settlements with those States had differences from and similarities to the master settlement agreement some general similarities include prohibiting billboard advertising or Transit advertising prohibiting the distribution of

branded items prohibiting any youth marketing limiting Outdoor advertising in summary as you have seen settlement restrictions affect many areas of the Philip Morris business it is important to remember that in addition to settlement requirements there are federal state and local laws that affect Philip Morris's business there are codes such as the marketing code to which Philip Morris subscribes and there are corporate policies that also guide
the poorest business the activities in which Philip Morris engages are governed by all of these

finally as we have described a vast amount of attention and energy has gone into complying with the settlement continuing compliance is important it is everyone's responsibility including yours Philip Morris wants each one of you to help make sure Philip Morris stays in compliance with the settlement in closing you will now hear from the senior vice president of corporate affairs

hi I'm Ellen Merlot thanks for participating in today's training session as you begin your career at Philip Morris it's important for you to understand the rules that guide us every day as we conduct our business that really was the point of today's session but what's every bit as important is the spirit of our commitment to living those rules as part of our culture here at Philip Morris USA because the decisions that we make

everyday have to be consistent with our mission and our values as Mike discussed with you earlier we're a company whose mission is to responsibly Market our products to adults who choose to smoke with this right comes the responsibility to help prevent youth smoking and while we have a youth smoking prevention department here at Philip Morris USA whose sole goal is to develop and support programs that help reduce the

the incidence of you smoking it is also the job of every employee at Philip Morris USA not just because it's the right thing to do for our employees our shareholders and Society at large but because doing the right thing and working for a company that does the right thing will give you a sense of Pride and being part of Philip Morris USA you're starting your career as a p.m. but I've been here for almost thirty one years it's a

static place to work because there are terrific people working here it's also a challenging place to work because of the many issues that confront us but with our mission and values to guide us as well as our commitment to the letter and spirit of the MSA will continue to make the right decisions as a company and as individuals I know you're going to love working here so good luck in your career as you move forward
